page.title: 01BUILTH (WEST) : GAZETEER
page.content: Topographically,the area consists of the valleys and interfluves of the Wye,Chwefru & Irfon,with the Eppynt escarpment & upland to the S.Heights range from about 150m in the flood plain tract of the Wye to 300m O.D. on the Eppynt margin.Minor streams such as the Cneiddon dissect the escarpment and flow NE to join the larger watercourses. Apart from woodland,most of the area is pasture and used for stock rearing. Excluding Builth and small clusters, eg.Cilmeri,scattered farms are the typical settlement form. The eastern edge includes about 65% of the urban area of Builth,the dominant service centre of the area. Developing from a Norman castle town,Builth expanded as a Victorian market & holiday centre.
